Projects (3)
Research of local adaptation of the introduced Cryptolaemus montrouzieri Mulsant based on population genomics
Project
Explore the genetic adaptation of the introduced Cryptolaemus montrouzieri in genome-level based on next-generation sequencing.
View
Systematic Paleontology of Coleoptera
Project
A well-preserved fossil specimen could provide the useful morphological information for further phylogenetic studies and a well-justified fossil calibration is crucial for the molecular dating analysis. In this project, we aim to study the systematic paleontology and paleobiology of Coleoptera based on our current taxonomic knowledge from extant beetles.
View
Diversity of the beetles associated ichneumonid wasp (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae) in South East Asia with emphasis on their evolutionary history and the fauna of Southern China
Project
The particular attention will be given to the Southeast Asian fauna of ichneumonid wasps since the region is highlighted as biodiversity hot-spot and particularly rich in the beetle fauna. As the beginning the important part of the study will be in Northern part of Oriental region, Southern China to determine the relationship between Oriental and Palaearctic faunas. Besides biogeography and taxonomy the special emphasis will be given to co-evolution of Hymenoptera, Coleoptera and their host plants.
